results.title: The Grizzly bear: a case study in field research
results.creator_credit: Irwin Rosten and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: Scientists Frank and john Craighead roam Yellowstone National Park armed with drug filled darts in order to study the formidable grizzly. Narrated by Alexander Scourby.

results.title: The Grievance
results.brief_description: This film illustrates the orderly processing of a grievance though several stages of negotiation between union and management, showing how the right of a worker with a genuine grievance are protected under the union’s contract. It shows the case of an unto-worker who was demoted for refusing to work inside a truck cab he considered too hot. The union registers the case as a legitimate grievance; it passes through three stages of negotiation in the plant, and eventually reaches an impartial arbitrator for the settlement.

results.title: The Greening
results.creator_credit: Gordon Glenn and Cradle Mountain Film Productions
results.brief_description: A record of the setting up of the instant lawn for the Swanston Street summer party which was held as part of Victoria’s 150th anniversary celebrations.

results.title: The Green plant
results.brief_description: Aspects of all forms of plant life; their fundamental functions (respiration, intake of food and outlet of waste matter, irritability etc.) Exist here as in the higher forms of life. The basic construction of a plant is described; the way it feeds and grows.

results.title: The Green machine
results.brief_description: The Green Machine is the Australian Army, and, to the accompaniment of Tchaikovsky’s 1812 Overture, we see depicted every aspect of life in the Australian Army of 1976.

results.title: The Green city
results.brief_description: Shows how green open space is being thoughtlessly gobbled up by the urbanising process. Demonstrates how development can take place without excessive destruction and illustrates various situations in different parts of the United States. Describes man’s changing environment and fortells the consequences if this change is permitted to take place without careful planning.

results.title: The Greedy frog
results.creator_credit: Murray Lomax, Kate White, Kate White Productions and South Australian Government (Film and Television Financing Fund)
results.brief_description: This aboriginal dreamtime story of The Greedy Frog is told using footage of Australian animals in the wild. Suitable for children the story tells of The Greedy Frog who drank all the water in the billabong leaving the plants and all the animals in the area without water. The koala wants to fix the situation and decides the solution is to make the frog laugh. After enlisting the help of all the other animals it is the Old Man Emu that finally saves the day.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Murray Lomax, Kate White, Kate White Productions and South Australian Government (Film and Television Financing Fund)

results.title: The Greatest run on earth
results.creator_credit: Sam Pillsbury, Pillsbury Films and Television New Zealand
results.brief_description: Why does an entire city suddenly go crazy on running? In the land where jogging was ‘invented’ by Arthur Lydiard twenty years ago, a film crew looked closely at how the city of Auckland, population a mere 500,000 is convulsed by preparations for this bizarre annual event, ‘the greatest run on earth’.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Sam Pillsbury, Pillsbury Films and Television New Zealand

results.title: The Greatest game on earth
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Roland Beckett, Australian National Football Council and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit
results.brief_description: Ricky, who has recently arrived in Australia, sees his first game of Australian Rules Football when he follows the boys of his neighbourhood to the Melbourne Cricket Ground where Geelong is playing Collingwood. At first the atmosphere is strange and new, but the boy soon becomes a part of the enthusiastic crowd excited by the fast field play, high punt kicks, snap shots for goal and clever manoeuvres which comprise Australia’s national sport.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Roland Beckett, Australian National Football Council and Melbourne Repertory Film Unit

results.title: The Greatest gamble
results.brief_description: Christopher Brasher assesses the gambles taken in supporting new inventions and introduces some of the men involved. Includes the trials of the Dr Barnes Wallis swing wing aircraft, and Professor F. C. Williams of Manchester University relives the moment when he saw the way of solving the problems of electronic memory. Other contributors includes Christopher Cockerell who discusses hovercraft, Geoffrey Stockdale on the take-apart ship and Donald Firth on the revolution in cars and machine tools.
